Climate Change is powered by the increase of Global temperature as CO2  and green house gasses accumulate in our atmosphere. These increased concentration is the result  of using fossil fuels to power our vehicles,  and other human and non-human activities that results the release of CO2 and other green house gasses. Also thermal pollution from the heat islands created by men, contributed to this. We should remember that the end point of energy transformation is to produce "waste heat". Whatever happens in the future, we have a role to play.  We should remember our own responsibility whether to make a stand to fight Carbon emission, fight the companies that produces pollution, or to stop our own selves from using technologies that would would give waste products that destroys our environment further. Climate Science is very important. We should remember that  geological epoch is brought about by changes in the Climate in the past.

Really CrashCourse? You're seriously going to push the atrazine conspiracy? Tyrone Hayes is a fraud with zero credibility; his study was riddled with flaws, it contained no real results, he refused to release the raw data, he got his research published through a loophole that circumvented the peer review process, he was unwilling to cooperate with the EPA to redo the study and most importantly of all two independent labs have repeated his study on a massive scale and were unable to recreate his 'findings.' Atrazine is safe. It genuinely surprises me that you would push this kind of pseudoscience. I mean, you do realize that you are essentially on the same page as Alex Jones now? That chemical he said was "turning the freaking frogs gay" is atrazine. Very disappointing. If you actually want to know about atrazine I highly suggest Myles Power's videos on the subject, he does a great job debunking this conspiracy.

The pushback against Climate Change narratives was not, and is not, just evil corporations telling lies, even though that is important.  Well into the 2000 respected scientific groups were questioning the relative contribution of human activity on climate change.  As the science entered the political sphere, education efforts were poor and strained the credulity of a public that had to make decisions.  The extent and rapidity of climate change remain contested, often dependent on computer models extending a century, whose performance is simply unknowable. And no where do we see the limitations of science more than in the question of response.  Putting huge economic and political resources into one intervention whose impact is uncertain is not, unfortunately, a simple scientific question.  And all this gets painted as “denial”, which is unfair and untrue, and, I would argue, counterproductive.

Opposition is less about the science and more about the presentation: namely, if you took how supporters think of and talk about climate change and apply it to any other topic, it would look like a scam. This is for many reasons, three of which I'll list now:
1. Climate change has been modified. It was originally global warming, but when the globe failed to warm it became Climate change instead. Rapture cults have done something quite similar, where they keep pushing back the date of the end times as each one comes to pass and nothing happens.
2. Predicting climate change requires large, complex simulations that need active human tweaking to get results. If someone with an agenda tampered with the simulation it'd be almost impossible to tell.
3. Most importantly, FAILED PREDICTIONS. Scientists and politicians have been making predictions of what climate change will do for almost two decades now, and almost all of them have been false. If a model of physics, chemistry, biology, or even sociology had such a terrible track record it would be scrapped entirely.


If you want to fully sway everyone, it's quite simple: make accurate predictions using objective unmodified data. Currently Climate Change fails all three, and as long as that's the case it looks like an illusion from outside, not an immutable aspect of reality.
